conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity vs. time graph for both objects A and B to determine the trend of acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2.
Graph A represents the velocity of object A.
Graph B represents the velocity of object B.
Graph A shows a constant velocity of 10 m/s.
Graph B shows a decreasing velocity, starting at 10 m/s and decreasing to 0 m/s over the time interval 0 to t2.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
For Graph A, the velocity is constant, so the acceleration is also constant.
For Graph B, the velocity is decreasing, so the acceleration is negative.
Graph B shows a decreasing velocity, which means the object is slowing down.
The negative slope of the velocity vs. time graph indicates that the acceleration is decreasing.
The acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2 is decreasing.
